measured_by: eye-tracking gaze duration on option’s AOI
justification: “eye-tracking studies that people are more likely to choose an option if they look at it for longer … recording participants’ eye movements … we calculated the proportion of time that each participant spent fixating on the area of interest … as a measure of option-specific attention allocation”

measured_by: proportion of samples drawn from an option in the sampling paradigm
justification: “we computed the experienced probabilities … and the proportion of samples from the safe option relative to the total number of samples. This proportion served as a measure of attentional bias to the safe versus the risky option”

measured_by: γ (gamma) parameter of Prelec’s two-parameter probability-weighting function
justification: “We used … CPT, with γ and δ as free parameters of the two-parameter probability-weighting function by Prelec (1998)”—the fitted γ quantifies the curvature of probability weighting

measured_by: δ (delta) parameter of Prelec’s two-parameter probability-weighting function
justification: The same modeling section notes δ as the elevation parameter: “the elevation parameter δ … parameters were fitted to empirical data”
